I had been watching a land Rover for some time and when I had saved up $1500 for a decent down payment I applied for the Rover and we'll of course approved,I emailed them copies of pay bills and references and they said that was all needed.I figured all good to go,so I called the next morning to say get the SUV ready and I would be there in an hour,they said what SUV was it again,I said the Rover you have 2 listed online and been online for over 2 months.The guy said oh sorry we sold that one last night,I said what about the other one he said that was also sold last night,I called BS.I told him if they were sold then update website.He said well we can get you any SUV wanted just give them time...lmao..I didn't let on that I had been watching that sub for months and I went to get the exact Rover 3 months ago and overnight it sold but,they can get them all the time,not with the same VIN numbers...lol...I don't think they even have a land Rover there,I think they looked a couple up online and put it on there site to draw in middle class buyers...there the biggest liars I ever seen and I've seen alot...there a joke and I tell anyone that ask don't ever go there for a car or there other lot named Equity First,same car dealer just different name.... CROOKS...I almost forgot there adds say $500 down for all,read fine print, it's $500 plus $999 for the tags and taxes so you need $1500 as a minimum down to drive away unless you pay them the other $1000 the next week...as I said ripoffs and crooks
Great experience!  Maria, the owner, was so friendly and helpful.  We just stopped in without an appointment and she took her time with my mom.  Very positive.

Very good selection beyond traditional Korean barbecue here. Very fresh food and very clean place. Good energy.  

We had the premium meal for two. The food comes real fast and before you know it, you're done. But with plenty of leftovers. Wagyu was nicely fresh and marbled, but tough.  The salad was awesome and fresh.  Shrimp was so so, kimchis were also so so.  Very Americanized meal.

Seating in the booths was very uncomfortable. So if there is an other option, I suggest you choose a table. Booths have very hard wooden seats with semi soft backing that was also WAY too far away from the table. Awkward seating situation that made us squirm through the meal.

They promote that you get a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp, which I think, contributes to the ratings here. They don't require a high rating, but would you eat a dessert after you show them that you just gave them a bad review? Nope.

Nellis is a bit of a hike for me, I rarely come here,just for doctor appointments and to visit with friends.

This base however is pretty good, the A&FRC offers support for not only just deployed airmen but to unaccompanied tours as well, which was a big help to me! 

The BX here is really nice, I wish they'd ID more people though, there were a LOT of people that should have not been using the BX, but whatever. I like the furniture store, but in true AAFEES fashion, its over priced and 100$ for delivery. 

The Commisarry is great, if I didn't live closer to Creech, I would shop here more often, maybe as gas prices continue to drop, I'll shop here more often. Great prices for meat and produce. I wish they'd limit the coupons here, these coupon hoarders come through here to clear out shelves.

All in all, this base is one of the better assignments we've had, hopefully more is come!
Just had my 1st gel manicure here - a great experience overall. Friendly, professional staff. Clean & lovely interior. Tracy, the owner is on to something here Exactly what I've been looking for!!

Updating the review. This place is gross. It really is a by or miss. There garbage laying around close to the food, and last time I got the chicken on the rocks the chicken tasted 2 weeks old because I'm pretty sure they mix the old
Chicken with the newer chicken on the flat top. It has declined majorly in the past 2-3 years. I rather go to other newer locations.

Horrible customer service and incredibly rude once we had an issue. Lisa (or someone who always answers the phone) hung up on me after 2 minutes of me politely asking what else could be done.   

Our Roof repair failed 2 years later. Was told nothing could be done since their work was out of warranty.  Recently had another roofer assess the problem and they made a long list of things A1 didn't do the first time around! No wonder it leaked.  We were specifically told a1 did the least amount of 

I'm making a BBB report.  Do not give this company your business when others will stand behind their work.
Yummmmm!!!! Big meaty chicken balls , and crispy too :)) happy dance ... I would order from them again. And they deliver:)

I'm going to give this place five stars for several reasons. First off this was my first time doing anything like this so I was a bit hesitant and a little nervous. The office is clean and wasn't very busy. I was greeted immediately upon opening the door and coming in. 
Liz and Jackie walked me and helped me through the quick and painless process. I was there less than a hour and had cash in hand upon leaving. Liz and Jackie were both patient and answered all my questions and concerns. 
The office also had an atm machine which I thought was nice for making cash payments back on your loan.

I ordered the taco salad which is really just a bed of lettuce over some blue corn tortilla chips. I got it with the chicken chili which I guess was ok, but the portion size is quite small. Really you're getting some chips, lettuce, and sour cream. Hardly "taco salad"

Gross. I'm from Southern California so I'm super bratty and picky about my pho. So what? I'm a pho diva. This place was a sad excuse for a Vietnamese restaurant.

I'm sorry, but any self-respecting Vietnamese person would not serve what they serve here and call it "pho". The meat tasted like it had been frozen, cooked, frozen again then served to me. Foul. The noodles had a plasticky smell that was definitely off-putting. 

Word to the wise. This will only be edible if you're completely smashed or hungover. Otherwise, steer clear or drive the 4 hours to Bolsa for a real bowl of pho.
Really good food and coffee! Its a must to stop and try! Small and cute coffee shop! A+++
Awesome barber, friendly and easy to talk to! Steve is super experienced, and did an amazing job on my boyfriend's hair today! Will definitely come again!
Great service with GF options. Change of gloves and a cross contamination warning. Super friendly and courteous.

Day after Christmas stores were overloaded with people looking for bargains, going to the movies, and eating out. We fell in the later category. Lucky, we found a parking space close to the restaurant. At home Red Robin is our go-to sit-down restaurant for burgers. 

Inside was packed, with no waiting in the pub. For two people the pub was perfect. The waitress appeared almost the moment we sat down. Ordered. Food came quick, hot ... happy to satisfy growing hunger pains. 

Hubby ordered Chicken salad. No surprises.  My fish and steak fries satisfied. 

At the table sat a computerized screen for paying the bill. LOVE it. Not only could we pay (with auto calculating tip meter), we used it to call the waitress for more salad dressing. No more hailing down harried wait staff. LOVE IT! And, before leaving, we answered a pretty lengthy online review, something I probably wouldn't have taken time for once I got home.

Nice to find reliable sources miles from home.

We had 14 people in our party and China Poblano was excellent for a large group. It was a Tuesday night and the restaurant was slammed, yet service was still very good.

We ordered everything from beers to margaritas to tacos to pork buns to fried rice. I tried a bite of everything. The stand outs for me were:

-Pollo con mole taco
-Cochinita taco
-Tuna ceviche

Our waitress was very accomodating and helpful. The restaurant also allowed us to bring in our own dessert for the occasion. 

I know some reviewers have commented on how expensive they think China Poblano is for the food, but for us it was a great deal. Our bill totaled a little over $700 for 14 people, including alcohol and gratuity, which averaged around $50/person. Not bad at all considering it was a nice, fun meal with delicious food that lasted over 2 hours.

It's not my favorite restaurant in the Cosmo nor is it my go-to spot for tacos but for a fun, casual place to eat on that property I think China Poblano is a very solid choice.

Five Star all day long! The Oyster Bar is amazing. Well worth the long wait. This is my absolutely favorite seafood soup spot! This is unlike any restaurant I've been to.
It's in the middle of the Palace Station casino with only 18 seats. They don't have any TV's for sports fans but definitely good and social environment.
From all the good reviews. I know personally this place is a MUST!!

Yeah, it's airport food, but I really like this place!  Imagine Chipoltle, but the burrito choices are the flavors of different countries. Indian, Thai, Mediterranean, and (of course) classic Mexican. My favorite is the Indian Tikka Masala chicken burrito with spicy chickpeas and cucumber cream sauce. Why would you eat a nasty airport burger when there are choices like this?

I started going here in 2012 for Brenda Martin but now see Dr. Nancy Jorgensen and just LOVE her. I am so happy I found this clinic; Nancy always makes me feel comfortable. I had an IUD placed in 2012 and removed this past June as we are now ready to start a family of our own. Very pleased to have found this Dr and Shea Women's Care as they are closely aligned with Scottsdale Shea Hospital which I have heard amazing things about.

came on a thursday for dinner around 7pm, and there was line out the door. had to wait 20-25 minutes before reaching the counter. i ordered the cheapest item on their menu, the farm salad. it took only 5 minutes before i was buzzed for my salad, which was delicious and filling.
Just paid 19 bucks for a piss poor lasagna and a single slice of stale cheese toast what was I thinking will not happen again.

Great place to stop for the night or stay a while.  We stopped for the night after a long day of traveling and the water park was just what the kids needed to burn off some energy.  I definitely recommend it. The place was nice and clean and the staff was friendly and helpful.

Where to begin.. Let's just if there were an option for 0 stars they get it! Some drunk lady came to our table with menus and could not remember what beers were on tap. So she sent George out 
"the bartender ". We asked if he had any IPA's on tap. He said what's and IPA I don't have any exotic beers. He was was a train wreck and said I'll send a server out. 
Soooo we left.

Wow .... just ... wow. These guys are legit.

I've had boba/bubble tea/whatever you want to call it, all over Asia (Including the OG in Taiwan), Canada and the United States.  Brew Tea Bar is in the top one or two places I would go back to if I had a teleportation machine and a choice to go anywhere I wanted to.  Why you might ask? 

- The drinks .. I've only had the tea-lattes but Holy Sh*t are they good!  The blend of the sweetness of the tea with the salty creaminess of the latte foam cannot be put into words (Even though I guess I just did?).  Let's just say I would bathe in that latte foam if I could.
- The friendly service .... these guys are fast, responsive and friendly.  Always offered to remake my drink if I didn't like it.  How can you not like that?
- Please note it's been busy every time I've gone (Weekend evenings) and it might be difficult to find seating inside but do yourself a favour and give it a try if you're in Vegas.  It's worth going out of your way to get one ... they're that good.

I had what could be considered sort of an emergency bridal situation.  My Yolan Cris custom made dress arrived 3 weeks late to me in San Francisco, making it impossible to get alterations done in time for my wedding in Ohio.  My mother tried everyone there, but it was bridal season and everyone was swamped. I was so doubtful of things working out that I bought a back up dress. My mother and I had almost given up, when she made her final hail mary and contacted I Do Bride. The owner was busy too, but she miraculously made time to get my dress done.  In three days she altered the waist and sleeves, did the hem (on a lace dress!) and put in a bustle.  The result was magnificent. I cannot express how grateful I am to I Do Bride!

My sister came here to get her belly button pierced. We walked in and asked if they had availability and their piercer had just stepped out but they gave him a call and he came within 5 minutes. The shop itself is pretty small so there wasn't much privacy. The piercing was done right next to a girl getting a tattoo and shoppers were able to walk by and watch my sister get pierced. You can't really complain because the shops at Pacific Mall are made of glass walls.

The procedure itself was pretty standard. She chose her jewellery, got marked and then got pierced. Everything was very clean and sterile, so no complaints! We were then instructed on how to clean the piercing. The whole process took less than 15 minutes and was $60.

Exceptional experience at Liilian Lottie!  I went to several wedding dress boutiques prior to going to Lillian Lottie, and none even compared!  Not only do they have a huge selection of dresses, but their customer service is incredible.  Warm and welcoming as soon as you walk in the door!  Elise helped me find my perfect dress, she was wonderful!  She always remembered me and the details of our destination wedding.  It is obvious that she loves what she does, and she is great at it!  I also had my dress altered by one of their recommended seamstresses, Sadie, and she was amazing!  My dress and veil were more beautiful than I could have imagined, perfect for a beach wedding!  Lillian Lottie definitely helped to make our wedding our favorite day!

I echo some of the other reviewers by saying that this is my favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas. I don't usually like to go to the strip to eat, unless it's a special occasion, but Tamba is worth it. It is very upscale in decor, yet has good ethnic flavor to it as well. Waiters are attentive, but not overly so (which I hate).

The buffet choices are excellent and all food is fresh and warm and tasty! 

The only drawback...it is closed for a couple of hours before dinner time (I belive 5:30PM or so?) I like my dinner early sometimes, and it was a bid of a disappintement.

Overall, recommended. Very clean place.

My wife and I were roaming the industrial and business park area of Phoenix looking for a decent bite to eat, preferably Mexican food. We finally stumbled upon a set of about five Mexican eateries. We decided on Salsitas, which seems to be a chain in the Valley of The Sun.

I wished that the woman had done a better job of speaking and understanding English. The food order was correct, and plentiful, not to mention cheap, but we had specifically asked for forks and were not given any. I had to go to our hotel's front deck and beg the clerk for a couple of plastic forks. 

The burrito was huge and very tasty. I had a couple of Grilled Chicken mini-tacos, and while they were pretty good, they were nothing special and I even found a few pieces of gristle. My wife had a chicken burrito and said it was huge and very good. She could not finish it. They also gave us some hot carrots so that scored well with her.

Ten bucks for all of that, including four salsas and sour cream. Not bad, but I'd like to try more.

If there was an option for zero stars, it would be a more accurate review. 

To keep this short, M&T had blocked two of my friends due to the "sporty" nature of their loafers (remember, this is Charlotte, the cultural hotbed of the southeast). They were enforcing a dress code expecting 100% of their patrons to be dressed in cocktail attire, as this is what the normal Charlottean looks like on a Thursday night. 

Once we made it past the bouncers, the bar itself was underwhelming, close to empty, and took forever to make overpriced drinks and undercooked food. 

If you want to spend a nice evening setting cash on fire and playing Russian roulette with salmonella, Merchant & Trade is the spot for you. If you are a decent human being that just wants a good drink, go to literally any place outside of uptown.

This was a fantastic bakery. Three of us had lunch here today, and boy was it a treat. I had the porchetta sandwich, and in my group we also had a mushroom focaccia sandwich and a soppressata sandwich. For pastries we got the dense chocolate torta, the seasonal tart, and one other pastry. All of what we bought was delicious, and the staff was very helpful. 

We also got the squid ink baguette to go, and the way it pairs with beautiful cheese and honey is remarkable. The only feedback that's constructive is a) they need more space for seating, and b) their pricing could be more reasonable.  All in all, highly recommend!

I thought it would be a lot better. The sauces were good and a lot of it tasted fresh. However very small portions compared to other places. They don't provide any utensils with delivery. Over salted their dishes. Got their veggie delight and it was basically broccoli and cauliflower. Where are the carrots, mushroom corn et?. Pad thai was good except tiny. Also you can really taste the tap water in the thai tea. Dissapointing may try again one more time but will be very specific on ingredients i want in the dish to remember utensils  etc.
Mouth watering melt in your mouth chicken and ribs both flavors mesquite and rotisserie. And their mashed potatoes to die for and great personal service

The veggie breakfast burrito is really terrible. It had only scrambled eggs and dry home fries with salsa verde on the side. No other seasoning, and the salsa flavors didn't even blend well with the bland main. Couldn't they at least add beans? Cilantro? Anything else to make it even worth the $9? 

I'm giving this place two stars only because the employees were friendly. My friends liked their food, and it sounds like the breakfast burrito with chorizo was good. Decent mini fruit salad that came with it as well with blueberries, grapes, and melon. (At least it wasn't all melon like many restaurant fruit salads.)

I guess I expected more. Im a huge fan of Celine but it seems like she is very tired (I can understand). The song selections in her new show are not very upbeat.... All seem sad in a way. Also wish she didnt turn her back to the audience so much. Overall its nice to see her live but I wish I wouldve seen her show when franco dragone was still running it- it looked a lot more fun.

Enjoyed a decliocius caramelized crossaint

Flaky golden crust with caramelized sugar rimmed atop.  Layers of buttery savory throughout the bite.   A must try bakery in Tempe, AZ.

My friends really like this place. I guess I just don't like crawfish. Or the sound of people eating and spitting them. The whole scene totally grossed me out. But like I said everyone I was with ate and enjoyed. I think they should expand the menu a bit and offer non-fried selections to friends of people who like crawfish slurping. :)

Typical Shady Insurance Practices. 

I've been using Progressive for a few months now and have been pleased with the service, but recently moved to a different town with my partner (also from the same town) and was pleased to find that they reduced her monthly insurance rate by nearly a hundred dollars because they were claiming that the town we were moving to was a safer place. Within a couple days I was notified of a change in my insurance payment as well but was surprised to find that it was nearly a hundred dollars HIGHER than it usually is. I call customer service and after being transferred around between a few people who had no clue what they were doing I was linked up with a gentleman who informed me that I now have an increased payment do to the ZIP code that I now reside in being more dangerous and high risk (opposite of the reason my girlfriend's payment was dropped). Not to mention a couple of months ago we both got a letter of non-renewal form the company only to find out upon calling that it was yet another mistake from their end that led them to think that I had moved to Texas, yet when I looked outside it seemed to me that I was still in Oregon...............

Long story short, I thought that I had found a good company to have insurance coverage with at last, but it turns out that Progressive is just as willing to lie and twist the reality that is insurance liability and risk to whatever form best fits THEIR needs.

I've already canceled my policy and as someone who is in the automotive industry I have no problem steering the customers in need that I meet away from Progressive when they ask for my recommendation.

Wish you could give ZERO stars. Ordered online for delivery. Over an hour later with still no food I called. The guy said they tried calling me three times to say something was wrong with my card but no one had called me! Total lie. The online order went through and there's nothing wrong with card!

Ok. Changed to 2 stars.  Delivery guy just showed up with food an hour and a half after i ordered. He played like he didn't know what I was talking about. I think they hurried, made food and delivered. My kids were ecstatic so we're happy now.  But the chow mein and moo goo gai pan were the exact same things.

This is one of the best Dental offices I have been to. The staff is so nice and know what they are talking about. Dr. Maro is AMAZING!!! My husband has had work done by him and is very impressed. I am actually excited to go see him myself. Keep up the great work.

My family is visiting Phoenix this week and I did plenty of Yelp research to find restaurants that could accommodate my gluten sensitive son. There were a few places with gluten free pizza, but we chose Sardellas since he could also get GF cheesy bread and the menu was clearly labeled with GF options. I was SO impressed with Sardellas! First, the cashier was very knowledgeable about the menu, they then stamp the ticket with gluten free so the kitchen is aware. My son loved his pizza! My other son got a slice of regular cheese and my husband and I got the buffalo chicken pizza. Overall we were very impressed by the cleanliness, food quality and attentiveness of the staff. We'll be back on our next trip down!

We had another company quote us $600 to
drain our pool for an acid wash just this past week, I called around and got a hold of Danny pretty immediately. I explained the issue and the first question he asked me what pool surface I had. I told him plaster and he advised not to drain it this time of the year as the other company suggested then he explained why as plaster will crack. I had no clue, Danny came out and did a once over on the pool then suggested their green to clean treatment and our pool went from green to clean in 2 days!! Looks amazing. I highly recommend Royalty Pools. Thanks for saving me a lot of money and being honest about the process.

First of all, this is a cafeteria style eating setup.  There are multiple food "stands" here, and you eat in a small area that is shared with others.  Not a big deal to me, but don't expect BWW or other establishment.  It is a cool idea though, more for college kids I think, since it is right near CSN.  

Ordered the fried pickles, jalapeno bombers, and traditional wings of course.

Pickles were good...it is the sauce that makes them actually.  The pickles by themselves didn't do much for me, but the cajun/mayo/ranch whatever it was is pretty solid and goes well with the vinegary/saltiness.  Jalapeno bombers were not very good....pretty bland...would not recommend.

As for the wings, I saw them cook the entire batch at one time.  But somehow, some of them got overcooked and dry, others were absolutely perfect.  There were some with a lot of blood vessels or whatever it is called, and one of mine had a broken bone with marrow all around the insides and chunks of bone pieces...yuck.  These must be frozen and transported via UPS freight (jk...kind of)....

Tried the parm garlic, mango habenero (I think), and carribean jerk bbq.  The garlic parm was ok...the habenero was like a basic hot to me...both were good, but not great.  What WAS great was their carribean jerk.  It was an excellent, spicy mixture of bbq and jerk'ness and really really wish all the others had that much thought and love put into them.

Since all the other reviews seemed great, I must have had a bad experience or bad choices in sauce at least.  If the wings were cooked right, it would have made this a 4 star, and more than one solid choice in flavor, would have bumped another outta me.  I guess I will stick with the chain restaurants for solid and consistent wings.

The plan was to switch away from M life resorts and establish a relationship with Wynn and/or Caesars after a so so trip to the Mirage last month. That was until a last minute trip with a 92 year old friend looking to scratch something off his bucket list with a trip to the Bellagio and the O show.

The Bellagio was just amazing. From the hotel, the atmosphere, the welcoming friendly staff, the fountain, the super clean beautiful room with the awesome view, the cafe, the conservancy and the O show. Gambling was good too.
It was so good that I'm going back with the family in 2 weeks to spoil them too.

I wish I got more names to single out some great staff. There was the young lady that checked us in and took special care of us. There is a very nice and the best beverage server at Bellagio with the purple highlights in her hair( liked her hair, let her keep the purple ) Maryann at Petrossian lounge is a sweetheart and Reatta the usher at the O show is the real star of that show. If more people were like her the world would be a better place.

This place is Awesome!! Great smoothies and amazing service!!
We had great time there.
Thank you!!

You can get your wings anyway you want them 
I will differently go back. 
I was thinking I was going on for a snack, ended up so FULL.
Best place ever wish they didn't have to close doors. There is a time where s place like this just becomes history and they need to keep it

Went in to canopi they had 2 strains with the same name. One was a low grade 11% thc and the other was a 20 something. I paid for an eighth of the "Top Shelf" which was obviously more expensive then the 11%. Well as soon as I leave I double checked because one bud was the entire eighth and sure enough they made me pay high for low lol but besides all that when I switched them out for the right one I opened it up and the "Top Shelf" was still soaking wet like they didn't even let it dry or cure. If you want just about the worst stuff in Vegas this is your go to place!
Quick service food has its own great taste very nicely surprised

Don't ask me how I found this place. It's in a residential place of Las Vegas. 

Randomly say down with some friends of mine that had been recommended this place and we came and sat at the sushi bar. The owner?? (Chef John) served us and we started with the sampler platter and worked our way down the menu. We had uni, Tuna Takaki salad, cucumber salad and just about everything else and ended with fresh mochi and a green tea Cree brle. Right??  

I'll just make a long story short. After driving 8 hours, being 9:00 at night it was the perfect way to end a great day. 

Find your way here and you won't regret it...and ask for Chef John if you really want VIP service. If you speak Taiwanese  you might even get a break on dessert :)

Awful service. It took 45 minutes for our food to arrive. My medium rare steak was so tough my knife bounced off it. Grilled cheese was congealed...it was gross. Waitress never came over to say kitchen was backed up.  It was also so cold with the a/c on that I had to order tea to keep warm. Manager did come over once summoned and was really no help. Avoid if possible.

I'm sitting here at the restaurant as a type this. Greeting was good, waiter helped me out as soon as I got seated. The only thing that rubbed me the wrong way was that he started telling me about the prices of the food. Other than that he was cool. I ordered the mahi tacos. Pretty good, they could have held the dry lettuce. This lettuce was mad dry and old. Just take glimpse of the photo.

Great food and service. Modern and urban decor sure to please the young profesional crowd. Beef tartare and salmon were a treat!!

The service was also excellent, very attentive yet discrete.

This place just opened Saturday. I had a 6 PC spicy chicken strip combo. Came with fries and some toast. The food was good 

They have free wifi

Fun atmosphere. It was nice having actual good sushi in a casual environment. The best deal IMO are the Vento box combos. 

Also, you must get their s'more milk shake. It saves lives!

No! No! No! DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE.
If they have 0 star I will give it to them. I went there and eat with my family. I found 3 different pieces sushi have hair in it!
I show it to the waitress and she gave it to the manager. They didn't do anything. They should shut this place down. Horrible!

No vegetables?  Not an onion, a pepper?

Overall a very boring selection.  No wonder I was the only one there

When they called to set up our appointment it was for the following Friday. (It was a Tuesday). Luckly, I was able to get the time off and left early for the 10-2PM appt time. At 2pm i had to call to make sure the technician was on the way. He had been hung up at the previous appt longer than he estimated. But, there was no thought on calling his next scheduled appts at all. 
When the technician started troubleshooting I explained that we had had the Freon serviced less than 5 months ago. He topped of the freon and called it good. Sunday, we noticed that dripping water out of the intake vents again, which were FULL of water dripping from the FROZEN coil, again. We called the Home Warrantee company to recall the trouble call which they could not do because Cool Blew did not close the work order. Then, when they called back after the home warrantee company issued a recall order they couldn't schedule it for another 3 days. For work they did not complete. 
With children and pets in the house its amazing they cannot back up their own work. Call someone else, Cold Blew couldn't give a lick about your 100 degree house even after they "repaired" the A/C.

Had implants done 2 yrs ago & there still looking Beautiful & strong!!
Entire Abby dental staff is the Epitome of Professional, Friendly Customer Service!!
Therefore, I brought Mom to have Dentures done.. Because Abby Dental is one I Trust & you should too!! 
They've Proved it Time & Again for over 20 Years!!
Hands Down, best Dental office in NV!!

My girlfriend and I just ate here for the first time today. The customer service of the staff gets a 5/5, they were friendly and helpful. The food gets a 3.5/5 (I gave it a 3, my gf gave it a 4). We both got the turkey bacon avocado lunch sandwich with no mustard. It was a bit dry, would have been better with a little ranch. I'm excited to try the breakfast sandwich next time. The interior was awesome, all open to the patio (its November so the weather was beautiful). Very cute. Overall, 4/5. I would suggest this place.

You are always out of hummus. Fix that problem because your hummus veggie wrap is pretty good and you've lost our business on many occasions. It makes me not want to even try coming back. I tried calling ahead of time to make sure you have hummus and your phone number is wrong. Get it together.

So excited to have a location 10 min from our house! The young teens at the drivethru  window were very friendly. These doughnuts were as yummy as ever!! Especially if you go during a HOT time.. Hot glazed doughnuts beween 6am-9am and 6pm-10pm!
